headline.kicker: THE WAY WE LIVE NOW: 5-5-02: QUESTIONS FOR BILL FRIST

docs.abstract: Interview with Bill Frist, only physician in US Senate, who talks about bioterror and health questions he most commonly gets from Senate colleagues; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Q: You've just published a book on the threat of bioterrorism. Did the anthrax letters turn everyone on Capitol Hill into hypochondriacs? At least every other day someone will mention something about a rash.
docs.snippet: Q: You've just published a book on the threat of bioterrorism. Did the anthrax letters turn everyone on Capitol Hill into hypochondriacs?    At least every other day someone will mention something about a rash.

headline.main: Los Angeles Inner City Beset By Chronic Health Problems

docs.abstract: South Central Los Angeles, blighted community that has made economic strides since rioting of 1992, still has some of most widespread and chronic health problems in Los Angeles County, including crippling levels of diabetes, lung cancer, asthma, obesity and heart disease; situation is aggravated by fact that largely Latino immigrant population has highest number of uninsured people in county; budget problems are forcing county health department to reduce its budget sharply and possibly lay off staff members (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Ten years after riots burned through the inner city here, Los Angeles is marking the occasion with a cascade of speeches, and to a remarkable degree, the talk is rosy. Community leaders have congratulated themselves for restoring the cityscape with dozens of new shopping complexes, and for conducting multiethnic forums.
docs.snippet: Ten years after riots burned through the inner city here, Los Angeles is marking the occasion with a cascade of speeches, and to a remarkable degree, the talk is rosy.    Community leaders have congratulated themselves for restoring the cityscape...
